line_1: To crown with solemn pomp an antient rite;
line_2: For one bless'd day, and with his friend's unite,

line_1: But I to no such horrid rite,
line_2: Sweet Queen, implore thy sacred light,
Far from the raven's croak, and bird of night,

line_1: " Round my green tomb perform the sacred rite,
line_2: "Assume my throne, and let thy yoke be light;

line_1: Sacred to May and Love's mysterious rite,
line_2: Vain hope! no more in choral bands unite
And thou sacred source of light,

line_1: In full expectance of the nuptial rite;
line_2: Forbear a while to seek the shades of night,

line_1: (What time the witch perform'd her rite)
line_2: Sprung from th' embrace of Taste and Night!

line_1: For here, with many a solemn mystic rite,
line_2: Ere these rude walls were rear'd remote from sight,
Greeting still the pow'r of night.

line_1: Unhappy fair! she hop'd the sacred rite
line_2: Their hearts should ever with their hands unite,
